question: Question_03_(c)
statement:
Let

\begin{align*}S = \left\{[x_1, x_2, x_3]^T:\, x_1 + x_2 + x_3 = 0\right\}\end{align*}

be the subspace of vectors in $\mathbb R^3$ whose components sum to
zero.

\textbf{(c)} Find a matrix \emph{B} so that \emph{R(B) = S}.
sols:
Since \emph{S} is the set of all possible linear combinations of its
basis vectors, and \emph{R(B)} is the set of all possible linear
combinations of its columns, we can simply populate the columns of
\emph{B} with (non-trivial linear combinations of) the basis vectors of
\emph{S}. For example $B=\begin{bmatrix}
-1 & -1\\
1 & 0\\
0 & 1
\end{bmatrix}$ or $B=\begin{bmatrix}
-1 & -1 & -\pi & -2 \\
1 & 0 & 0 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & \pi & 1
\end{bmatrix}$
hints:
The range of a matrix \emph{B} is the set of all possible linear
combinations of its column vectors.
